Ganz ehrlich, wer es nicht gespielt hat, gehört erschlagen. Jeder der EgoShooter zockt, muss Half Life gespielt haben!!!!!!!! Am besten dieses hier, wenn dir die Grafik zu "übel" ist, gönn dir Black Mesa. Aber HL ist der SHOOTER überhaupt. War auch mein erster. Überzeugt, Setting stimmt, Design und co. Da passt einfach alles. OK, heute ist die Grafik nichts besonderes mehr, damals aber ein hingucker. Es macht auch heute noch Laune, nach dem wohl längsten Intro in der Spielegeschichte. Gefühlte 1000 Jahre, bis man anfangen kann. Aber das hat Kult. Allein schon die Brechstange, ist einfach nur MEGA. Aus HL entsprang auch Counter Strike. Daher, das Game hat in vielerei Hinsicht die Geschichte der heutigen Shooter mit gebrägt.

Kauf lohnt sich noch immer, Ehre Bruder!

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Half-Life, the game that started this site for all intents and purposes. A game that was revolutionary when it launched changing the FPS landscape and the way stories are told in games. However over 2 decades later, how does it stack up?
Pretty well it turns out for the first half anyways.
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Considering its age, the game plays remarkably well. Very few janky elements exist and level geometry behaves as it should. Shooting feels right and all the guns pack quite a bit of punch. However there is one odd element of the gameplay and that is the speed of movement. Considering how much you are punished for running and gunning, the movement system doesn't exactly lend itself well to hiding behind cover or peeking from corners, this floaty movement also causes issues later on in the game when you are asked to perform tight jumps. However throughout my playthrough, the game controlled well enough to let me do what I want when I want.
[h1]Level Design[/h1]
Outstanding. For the first half anyways. The first half of the game never lets up in introducing you to new environments, interesting puzzles and dynamic encounters and despite the game tending to hand out cheap damage from ambush attacks, I didn't feel too annoyed by them as it sets up the foreboding atmosphere they wanted, where literally everything alive and not alive is out to get you. As Gordon gets more powerful however, problems start to arise, from one hit kills that basically require you to know what is coming to the ambush attacks now dealing significant amount of damage, things start feeling more unfair than they should and this becomes incredibly apparent when you face the final boss where jumping 1 second too early can kill you, getting unlucky can kill you. Beating him basically requires save scumming which I do not appreciate.[spoiler] I know people like Xen and I tried liking it too, in fact I did like the otherworldly aspects and little touches of civilisation thrust in because it would be easy to treat the aliens as savages but Half-Life shies away from that, most of the time anyways. But Xen brings too many downsides in my eyes and represents the lowest point for me. From samey corridoors to ambush tactics in full flow, Xen just isn't fun.[/spoiler]
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
While the first half of Half-Life more than stands up to the test of time, the second just doesn't stack up. Saying that though, the first half is good enough to make the game worth playing on its own right.
Even though some of its design decisions have been dated by the passage of time Hlf life is still a groundbreaking shooter with lots to offer in the modern day
EFSANE

趁着这段租不到vr玩Alyx之前的空窗期，我把这款比我大了四岁的游戏通关了。以现在的眼光来看，《半条命》很多地方做得确实狗屎，不过在二十二年前，这款游戏确确实实是拿到了多家媒体的年度最佳。在当年游戏里很多元素都是极富开创性的，我甚至有种“计算机技术的发展水平制约了电子游戏发展”的错觉。当然现实是：计算机发展让上个世纪的电子游戏玩家们，体验到了半条命这样惊艳的大师之作。
对于游玩建议：如果你可以忍受二十二年前粗糙的画面效果、诡异的音效、“极具年代感”的射击移动手感和糟糕的游戏指引，那这款游戏仍然值得在2020年花上十几个小时品味。
